commit_message:
Switch c8-standalone to content provider

This change switches c8-standalone job to the content provider
dependency relation so the jobs share the produced artifacts.
It has been forgot previously.

Nuke c7 jobs from master layout.

Change-Id: I75172f2f55e8ef9adc207320e6f0bdebb310d2f8

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-20 16:33:29.000000000', 'message': "NetApp SolidFire: Fix replication

This patch addresses several of the problems currently found in this
driver:

 - When creating a SolidFire volume with a volume type that has
replication enabled the replication_status of this volume was not
changing.
 - During initialization, if a cluster is already paired, the driver
fails to load.
 - Driver does not create volumes on the replication target on
several configurations. For example, if the volume is being
created from a snashot or from another volume, etc.
 - During Failback, the driver doesn't update iSCSI connection
info to the secondary cluster nor the volume's replication status.

Closes-bug: #1834013
Closes-bug: #1751932
Change-Id: I920f958db1d48e52b548082d852c03f427a279ca
Co-Authored-By: Fernando Ferraz <sfernand@netapp.com>
Co-Authored-By: Thiago Correa <thiago.correa@netapp.com>
(cherry picked from commit 215d6b2b272847d695c5c5d17c9d387e123b1396)
(cherry picked from commit 7b227c647d5d81c1ae9e54b0e5fd76cc07c73257)
"}]
commit_message:
NetApp SolidFire: Fix replication

This patch addresses several of the problems currently found in this
driver:

 - When creating a SolidFire volume with a volume type that has
replication enabled the replication_status of this volume was not
changing.
 - During initialization, if a cluster is already paired, the driver
fails to load.
 - Driver does not create volumes on the replication target on
several configurations. For example, if the volume is being
created from a snashot or from another volume, etc.
 - During Failback, the driver doesn't update iSCSI connection
info to the secondary cluster nor the volume's replication status.

Closes-bug: #1834013
Closes-bug: #1751932
Change-Id: I920f958db1d48e52b548082d852c03f427a279ca
Co-Authored-By: Fernando Ferraz <sfernand@netapp.com>
Co-Authored-By: Thiago Correa <thiago.correa@netapp.com>
(cherry picked from commit 215d6b2b272847d695c5c5d17c9d387e123b1396)
(cherry picked from commit 7b227c647d5d81c1ae9e54b0e5fd76cc07c73257)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-02 12:21:58.000000000', 'message': 'Do not require authentication for the validator CLI

Since most of the actions of the validator is based on the filesystem,
we really don't need to require auth.
The only subcommand that might require it is the "run", since it might
go through the inventory generation.

Also, pass the "--os-cloud" parameter down to the
tripleo-ansible-inventory script. Value is hardcoded, since it is an
entry name we can't set (yet). It allows to authenticate only for the
relevant part of the validation run.

Resolves: rhbz#1892323
Closes-Bug: #1902052

Change-Id: I32c1e006d10ceb541aadb486befd8aa8fc6aa045
(cherry picked from commit aafd981948b28b7786c9c8d5f9b0e7e1b3f9371f)
'}]
commit_message:
Do not require authentication for the validator CLI

Since most of the actions of the validator is based on the filesystem,
we really don't need to require auth.
The only subcommand that might require it is the "run", since it might
go through the inventory generation.

Also, pass the "--os-cloud" parameter down to the
tripleo-ansible-inventory script. Value is hardcoded, since it is an
entry name we can't set (yet). It allows to authenticate only for the
relevant part of the validation run.

Resolves: rhbz#1892323
Closes-Bug: #1902052

Change-Id: I32c1e006d10ceb541aadb486befd8aa8fc6aa045
(cherry picked from commit aafd981948b28b7786c9c8d5f9b0e7e1b3f9371f)

commit_message:
zuul: Merge nova-evacuate into nova-multinode-live-migration

Both jobs deploy a multinode env before running their tests so just
append the new nova-evacuate tests to the end of the job.

Change-Id: If64cdf1002eec1504fa76eb4df39b6b2e4ff3728

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-29 17:26:09.000000000', 'message': "Modify glance's copy_image permission for nova-ceph-multistore

nova-ceph-multistore setup needs non-admin users to copy the image.
To allow that glance's policy was overriden to allow public
images to copy. This restriction again can cause issue if there
is any new copy image tempest test try to copy private image with
admin users.
- https://review.opendev.org/#/c/742546/

Let's allow everyone to copy every image to make it work
for all type of test credentials.

Change-Id: Ia65afdfb8989909441dba55faeed2d78cc7f1ee7
"}]
commit_message:
Modify glance's copy_image permission for nova-ceph-multistore

nova-ceph-multistore setup needs non-admin users to copy the image.
To allow that glance's policy was overriden to allow public
images to copy. This restriction again can cause issue if there
is any new copy image tempest test try to copy private image with
admin users.
- https://review.opendev.org/#/c/742546/

Let's allow everyone to copy every image to make it work
for all type of test credentials.

Change-Id: Ia65afdfb8989909441dba55faeed2d78cc7f1ee7

[{'created': '2020-10-10 05:39:15.000000000', 'message': 'Add Python3 Wallaby unit tests

This change ensures unit testing is in place for all of the tested
runtimes for Wallaby.

See also the Project Testing Interface (PTI) in OpenStack Governance.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html

commit_message:
Add Python3 Wallaby unit tests

This change ensures unit testing is in place for all of the tested
runtimes for Wallaby.

See also the Project Testing Interface (PTI) in OpenStack Governance.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html

Change-Id: Ic5372a7f9d3429df4ef457f47970340652a41808

Remove centos7 tripleo job from layout

c7 tripleo jobs should run on train/queens only. To get equivalent
coverage replace c7 with c8 content provider jobs.

commit_message:
Fix pygments style

New theme of docs (Victoria+) respects pygments_style.
Since we starts using Victoria reqs while being on Ussuri,
this patch ensures proper rendering both in Ussuri and Victoria.

Change-Id: I8a77e5e6d7f178f1f6926b0c1e04c8167cb7c86f

commit_message:
Determine default IPv4 route device only when needed

Sometimes instances don't have an IPv4 default route, so only check for
it when we actually need it. In a followup patch we could extend the
code to check for an IPv6 default route instead or in addition.

Related-Bug: 1902002
Change-Id: Ie6cd241721f6b1f8e030960921a696939b2dab10

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I1f0e54bb15f552e2668fed83c81c837c65982063

commit_message:
Fix ovs agent, avoiding import error

A recent change[1] added a "iptables_firewall" import to the
ovs agent, which isn't importable on Windows[2]. This prevents
the neutron ovs agent from starting on Windows.

This patch updates the security group driver check, avoiding the
unsupported import.

[1] Iecf9cffaf02616342f1727ad7db85545d8adbec2
[2] http://paste.openstack.org/raw/799030/

Closes-Bug: #1899775

Change-Id: I8877dbf4b0b9cd185ae0b8715b7e8e6d87e0afcc

rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/victoria branch, tests will

'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/victoria

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/victoria branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ie481e261ce259c3a3609fb1fe80f032e9b9d92e4

subject: Check auth_url as well as identity version api
messages:
[{'account_id': 14764, 'date': '2017-12-07 14:27:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14764, 'date': '2017-12-08 00:52:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 14764, 'date': '2017-12-08 01:41:34.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from check_auth_url_as_well_when_drop_domain_info to bug/1737069'}, {'account_id': 14764, 'date': '2017-12-08 10:07:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 14764, 'date': '2017-12-08 17:33:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-03-26 00:08:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 14764, 'date': '2018-04-01 12:47:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 14764, 'date': '2018-04-06 07:34:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(2 comments)

Thanks for reviewing, I added reference to launchpad for bug report and fixed import statement place for re. Please check it out.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-07-08 21:37:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

identity_api_version is actually not related to what version is used for auth. If a person wants to communicate that they want auth version v3 explicitly, they should set auth_type to v3password.'}, {'account_id': 14764, 'date': '2018-07-09 03:28:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

@Monty Taylor 
I understood "identity_api_version is actually not related to what version is used for auth." and actually this patch come out of this thought.
According to osc-lib implementation, if identity_api version configured to use v3, domain related information dropped even if that information used by auth_url. 

we should not just refer to identity api version to judge if we should drop domain information or not, because other parameter (like auth) depend on these value.'}, {'account_id': 14764, 'date': '2018-07-09 03:30:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

sorry I explained in the wrong way.
> if identity_api version configured to use v3, domain related information dropped even if that information used by auth_url. 

if identity_api version configured to use v2, domain related information dropped even if that information used by auth_url.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-07-09 15:00:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)

Gotcha - and yeah, I've actually come around to a different point of view on the thing I was saying originally.

So I think this should be fine - but I think the inline comment should be addressed first."}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-07-09 15:00:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 14764, 'date': '2018-07-10 02:35:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Actually I checked https://github.com/openstack/openstacksdk/blob/master/openstack/config/loader.py which is the code to be in charge of generating config, auth_url seems be defined out of auth key.

I checked with debugger and still seems be out of "auth"


> /usr/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/osc_lib/cli/client_config.py(95)_auth_v2_ignore_v3()
(Pdb) l
 90
 91             # NOTE(hieulq): If USER_DOMAIN_NAME, USER_DOMAIN_ID, PROJECT_DOMAIN_ID
 92             # or PROJECT_DOMAIN_NAME is present and API_VERSION is 2.0, then
 93             # ignore all domain related configs.
 94             import pdb; pdb.set_trace()
 95  ->         if (str(config.get('identity_api_version', '')).startswith('2') and
 96                     config.get('auth_type').endswith('password')):
 97                 domain_props = [
 98                     'project_domain_id',
 99                     'project_domain_name',
100                     'user_domain_id',
(Pdb) config["auth"]
{'project_id': '***', 'user_domain_name': '***', 'project_name': '***'}'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-07-10 18:51:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Yes - but that's because your input mock data in the test defines it outside of the auth dict. In normal usage, it should be inside the auth dict. So in this case, the test works, and you're right about the debugger, but it's the code and the test cancelling each other out.

BTW - I'm going to port this patch over to openstacksdk (unless you want to) so that we can just do it when we're processing the parameters in the first place."}, {'account_id': 14764, 'date': '2018-07-11 02:32:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

@Monty Taylor 
Sorry I should've mentioned the debugger output was captured when i executed openstack cli command not when I execute test.
So If we expect auth_url to be inside auth dict, we have to modify openstacksdk so that make sure auth_url to be inside auth dict by another patch for openstacksdk.
So I'm gonna change  this patch as you pointed if that behaviour is expected. 
But after that, we will have to write another patch to make sure auth_url to be in auth dict around https://github.com/openstack/openstacksdk/blob/master/openstack/config/loader.py#L1031

> BTW - I'm going to port this patch over to openstacksdk (unless you want to) so that we can just do it when we're processing the parameters in the first place.
Does this patch indicate literally this https://review.openstack.org/#/c/526413/?
or indicate the patch to make sure auth_url to be in auth dict?"}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-07-11 12:57:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Yes please! If there are cases where it's not in auth- or it's not being moved there by loader - then we need to fix them in sdk and write some tests.

thank you very much!"}, {'account_id': 14764, 'date': '2018-07-11 14:13:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-07-11 14:17:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

Awesome!'}, {'account_id': 14764, 'date': '2018-07-11 16:38:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

^^^ above error is because of openstacksdk, this won't resolve until we fixed the issue that auth_url is not in auth dict as we discussed here"}, {'account_id': 14764, 'date': '2018-07-11 17:14:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

@Monty Taylor 
After I got the error in openstackclient related gate, I did some investigation and I started to think this patch should check auth_url key which is not in auth dict.
I understood your point, auth_url should be in auth dict and actually that movement happened after _auth_v2_ignore_v3 function. the line is here https://github.com/openstack/openstacksdk/blob/master/openstack/config/loader.py#L1041 
But this movement happened after _auth_v2_ignore_v3 function unfortunately.

So If we still want to check auth_url inside auth dict at _auth_v2_ignore_v3 function, we need to store auth_url into auth dict before _auth_v2_ignore_v3 function evaluated. 

What do you think about it?'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-07-12 21:43:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: -Code-Review

Hrm. This is tricky. If this is happening before the openstacksdk move of auth_url to the auth dict - then I think we really need to do this directly in openstacksdk - because otherwise for a user who puts auth_url in the auth dict directly (all of my clouds.yaml entries have auth_url in auth dict, for instance) will have a different behavior from a user who doesn't.

I'll try to look at SDK for this tomorrow morning - but if you beat me to fixing sdk, awesome. :)"}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-11-06 10:36:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Patch Set 4 was rebased'}]

commit_message:
Check auth_url as well as identity version api

When check the identity api version whether we should drop domain
information from configuration or not, we should check auth_url as well.
Otherwise the user can not get authenticated if the user use the
keystone api v3 for authentication without specifying identity api
version by command option or environment variable. Because the default
identity api version in configuration is currently configuread as v2.0.

Change-Id: Ib90fc937fb018b9c9dd96c7d87f8ddb7c6c52f0b
Closes-Bug: #1737069

commit_message:
Use py3 as the default runtime for tox

Moving on py3 as the default runtime for tox to avoid to update this at
each new cycle.

Wallaby support officially the following runtimes [1]:
- Python 3.6
- Python 3.8

During Victoria Python 3.7 was used as the default runtime [2] however this
version isn't longer officially supported.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/wallaby.html#python-runtimes-for-wallaby
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/victoria.html#python-runtimes-for-victoria

Change-Id: Ieb5fd2c1efd9297b9b589e6f13cbe5e0a4cb73cb

commit_message:
Forward broker requests on rbd-mirror relation

To be able to support mirroring of pools with advanced features
the RBD Mirror charm needs more information about the intent
behind pools requested in a deployment. We solve this by
forwarding all the broker requests in the deployment.

It is up to the consumer of the rbd-mirror relation to filter
the requests and relay the ones eligible for use on a remote
cluster.

Change-Id: I16196053bee93bdc4e5c62f5467d9e786b047b30

commit_message:
Added styling for rST rubric directive.

StarlingX is using the rST rubric directive to style headings such as
'Prerequisites', 'Procedure', and 'Results' in tasks without having them
appear in the TOC. There is currently no support for rubrics in the
StarlingX theme. This file appears to be the correct place to add it.
Testing to see if merge is picked up by StarlingX tox builds.

Change-Id: Ia339ad02522891c2b0b593dc782b67220565b87f
Signed-off-by: Stone <ronald.stone@windriver.com>

commit_message:
zuul: Stop testing against Tempest

Neither Tempest itself nor any of the service projects use OSC. As such,
there's no reason to run Tempest jobs here. It's simply a waste of
resources.

Change-Id: I18c45d28798c20c231b945f6fad077012cdbbaee
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 58b6920d3bfe5ccdd17bccf1f8e4ef578a6a94be)

commit_message:
Add unit test for memcache error limiting with single server

Adds a unit test to verify that when MemcacheRing is configured with a
single server, that server is not error limited.

Change-Id: If6c91d8169602b60e9a6b9dd9e2d93a4e246ad41
Related-Change: Ibeaf6bdcdfb32addb277858f7095c9f0035fd5f3

commit_message:
memcache: change strategy for always available servers

Previously, when all but a configurable minimum number of memcache
servers have been error limited, remaining servers are never error
limited. Consequently the server that has most recently been observed
to fail remains available. With this change, one of the remaining
servers may be error limited, but if that happens the server that is
closest in time to being available again (i.e. the server that was
least recently error limited) is made prematurely available in order
to maintain the required minimum number of available servers.

Change-Id: I6bdab4210a42fcec84d7c288a8437d5ab81318c4
Related-Change: Ibeaf6bdcdfb32addb277858f7095c9f0035fd5f3

subject: memcache: make minimum number of servers configurable
messages:
[{'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2020-10-23 17:32:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-10-23 18:45:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

(2 comments)

Seems like a reasonable and intuitive way to configure it. Let's shop around the default value at the PTG next week; I'm torn about whether to preserve the old behavior by default or have it default to one to at least *try* to keep us from overwhelming db servers if memcached goes sideways."}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2020-10-26 12:28:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2020-10-26 12:30:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2020-10-26 12:33:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'm not sure how useful, or even desirable, it is to set minimum_servers > 1. That can result in one failing server always being tried before moving on to a good fallback server. Or, worse, a failing server is tried, fails, is error limited and another failing server is reinstated (prematurely) only to fail, before a good server is used (ass illustrated by new test in follow on https://review.opendev.org/#/c/759502)"}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2020-11-06 10:40:43.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

superseded by https://review.opendev.org/#/c/761029/'}]

determines the minimum number of servers that will always be available
for connection attempts regardless of error rates. For a given value
N, memcached will not error limit a server if doing so would result in

commit_message:
memcache: make minimum number of servers configurable

Add a memcache config option 'memcache_minimum_servers' which
determines the minimum number of servers that will always be available
for connection attempts regardless of error rates. For a given value
N, memcached will not error limit a server if doing so would result in
less than N available servers remaining.

The default value is 0, which results in legacy behaviour i.e. all
servers might be simultaneously error limited. A value less than zero
will be adjusted to zero. A value greater than the number of
configured memcache servers will be adjusted to equal the number of
memcache servers.

Related-Change: Ibeaf6bdcdfb32addb277858f7095c9f0035fd5f3
Change-Id: I2e10076b7e0741e2c45395439bd2e6d2f8a6025b

commit_message:
Skip k2k wrapper creation

OSC knows how to provide the k2k auth wrapper now if it's configured.
Stop bothering to do it ourselves here.

[{'created': '2018-08-29 20:37:01.000000000', 'message': "issubclass() being called on an instance - take 2

There is a check being made on the provided formatter to detect if it's a function and emit
deprecation warnings.

The formatter can be either a plain function or a class. issubclass fails in the first case, but
changing it to isinstance fails in the second. Both cases are observed in actual code
(openstackclient and neutronclient), so this has to be fixed. The current state (issubclass) breaks
openstackclient CLI.

Because there are no 100% proof methods of detecting whether an object is a function or a class
(both are callables), use try/except and catch the failure of issubclass in the first case.

See also:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/581886/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/586617/

commit_message:
issubclass() being called on an instance - take 2

There is a check being made on the provided formatter to detect if it's a function and emit
deprecation warnings.

The formatter can be either a plain function or a class. issubclass fails in the first case, but
changing it to isinstance fails in the second. Both cases are observed in actual code
(openstackclient and neutronclient), so this has to be fixed. The current state (issubclass) breaks
openstackclient CLI.

Because there are no 100% proof methods of detecting whether an object is a function or a class
(both are callables), use try/except and catch the failure of issubclass in the first case.

See also:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/581886/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/586617/

Change-Id: I288fe792caf247f597ae4ffec4aa69c3531f1144
Story: 2003133
Story: 2003142
Story: 2003322

commit_message:
Sync Sphinx requirement

Sync sphinx dependency with global requirements. It caps python 2 since
sphinx 2.0 no longer supports Python 2.7.

Change-Id: Ibc1efffa8a6741d536cd4f9f52b52711befa912e

commit_message:
Implement auth caching

Keystoneauth provides a way to identify plugin configurations and to
extract and set the authentication data so that it can be cached and
reloaded to reuse existing authentication.

Take this information from keystoneauth and if available set it into the
local keyring so that the auth can be reused if the previous token is
still valid. If is fine to set expired information back into the auth
plugin as the plugin will refresh the authentication if it has expired.

Change-Id: Ic65eb32d66673dc335c9cb17ea32b944fdf5bc55

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Signed-off-by: Andreas Florath <Andreas.Florath@telekom.de>

commit_message:
Fix osc-lib interface change: throw osc-lib Forbidden

The patch https://review.opendev.org/#/c/673389/
introduced a regression by changing the osc-lib
interface.

This patch changes the exception from the
generic CommandError back to a specific Forbidden
exception.

The patch
https://review.opendev.org/683118
catches this exception and passes on, i.e.
re-implements the same behavior as before.

Story: 2006547

Change-Id: I8496ccab5282836931f7c41c5e3e82221a8637f6
Signed-off-by: Andreas Florath <Andreas.Florath@telekom.de>

commit_message:
Monkey patch original current_thread _active in processutils

Monkey patch the original current_thread to use the up-to-date _active
global variable. This solution is based on that documented at:
https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/issues/592

[{'created': '2020-06-02 17:33:37.000000000', 'message': "Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343

Change-Id: I4d47517c421e89b45779623bddf37769f293df9b
"}]
commit_message:
Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: I4d47517c421e89b45779623bddf37769f293df9b

commit_message:
Update requirements URLs in tox config

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so will switch to the correct
upper-constraints list automatically when the requirements repository branches.

commit_message:
columns: Make 'FormattableColumn' comparable

Currently, comparing instances of this fails:

  >>> from cliff.columns import FormattableColumn
  >>> class Test(FormattableColumn):
  ...     def human_readable(self):
  ...         return str(self._data)
  ...
  >>> data = {'x': 'y'}
  >>> x = Test(data)
  >>> y = Test(data)
  >>> x == y
  False

Clearly it should not. Resolve this by implementing a custom comparison.

Change-Id: I4b96475ca6a689f4055dc5ea34b82b3867a65555
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
Story: #2008320
Task: #41218

[{'created': '2020-11-04 15:38:40.000000000', 'message': 'wip fix memcached logging

Change-Id: If5487c9be745ebd6bc3ebe172e28dc59e6855188
'}, {'created': '2020-11-04 18:51:34.000000000', 'message': "Fix memcached logging

Even though we're setting memcached::logfile:
'/var/log/memcached/memcached.log' there are no logs created in
/var/log/containers/memcached.

The reason for this is that memcached::logfile in puppet-memcached
simply adds a shell redirect to a file. These redirecs are
passed by tht and kolla to the memcached process invocation as parameters
of memcached and so are not read being read by the shell process
and nothing gets redirected. That is why we observe that on a broken
container the redirections are arguments to memcached:

[root@controller-0 ~]# ps aux | grep memcache | grep -v containers
    42457     358189  0.0  0.0 744088 10960 ?        Sl   15:21   0:00 /usr/bin/memcached -p 11211 -u memcached -m 16000 -c 8192 -vv -l 172.17.1.138 -U 0 -X -t 8 >> /var/log/memcached/memcached.log 2>&1

Fix this by forcing memcached to log on stdout and at the same
time creating the redirect on the shell parameters that invoke
memcached.

Tested on a Train environment and I correctly get:
1) Proper logging
[root@controller-0 ~]# ls -l /var/log/containers/memcached/memcached.log
-rw-r--r--. 1 42457 42457 29086 Nov  4 18:00 /var/log/containers/memcached/memcached.log

2) No unused redirections inside the memcached process:
[root@controller-0 ~]# podman exec -it -uroot memcached ps -ef
UID          PID    PPID  C STIME TTY          TIME CMD
memcach+       1       0  0 18:47 ?        00:00:00 dumb-init --single-child -- kolla_start
memcach+       6       1  0 18:47 ?        00:00:00 /usr/bin/memcached -p 11211 -u memcached -m 9953 -c 8192 -vv -l 172.17.1.50 -U 0 -X -t 4

Co-Authored-By: Damien Ciabrini <dciabrin@redhat.com>

Resolves: #1902922

Change-Id: If5487c9be745ebd6bc3ebe172e28dc59e6855188
"}]
commit_message:
Fix memcached logging

Even though we're setting memcached::logfile:
'/var/log/memcached/memcached.log' there are no logs created in
/var/log/containers/memcached.

The reason for this is that memcached::logfile in puppet-memcached
simply adds a shell redirect to a file. These redirecs are
passed by tht and kolla to the memcached process invocation as parameters
of memcached and so are not read being read by the shell process
and nothing gets redirected. That is why we observe that on a broken
container the redirections are arguments to memcached:

[root@controller-0 ~]# ps aux | grep memcache | grep -v containers
    42457     358189  0.0  0.0 744088 10960 ?        Sl   15:21   0:00 /usr/bin/memcached -p 11211 -u memcached -m 16000 -c 8192 -vv -l 172.17.1.138 -U 0 -X -t 8 >> /var/log/memcached/memcached.log 2>&1

Fix this by forcing memcached to log on stdout and at the same
time creating the redirect on the shell parameters that invoke
memcached.

Tested on a Train environment and I correctly get:
1) Proper logging
[root@controller-0 ~]# ls -l /var/log/containers/memcached/memcached.log
-rw-r--r--. 1 42457 42457 29086 Nov  4 18:00 /var/log/containers/memcached/memcached.log

2) No unused redirections inside the memcached process:
[root@controller-0 ~]# podman exec -it -uroot memcached ps -ef
UID          PID    PPID  C STIME TTY          TIME CMD
memcach+       1       0  0 18:47 ?        00:00:00 dumb-init --single-child -- kolla_start
memcach+       6       1  0 18:47 ?        00:00:00 /usr/bin/memcached -p 11211 -u memcached -m 9953 -c 8192 -vv -l 172.17.1.50 -U 0 -X -t 4

Co-Authored-By: Damien Ciabrini <dciabrin@redhat.com>

Resolves: #1902922

Change-Id: If5487c9be745ebd6bc3ebe172e28dc59e6855188

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-01 04:10:22.000000000', 'message': 'Update pci stat pools based on PCI device changes

At start up of nova-compute service, the PCI stat pools are
populated based on information in pci_devices table in Nova
database. The pools are updated only when new device is added
or removed but not on any device changes like device type.

If an existing device is configured as SRIOV and nova-compute
is restarted, the pci_devices table gets updated but the device
is still listed under the old pool in pci_tracker.stats.pool
(in-memory object).

This patch looks for device type updates in existing devices
and updates the pools accordingly.

Change-Id: Id4ebb06e634a612c8be4be6c678d8265e0b99730
Closes-Bug: #1892361
'}, {'created': '2020-09-09 12:06:19.000000000', 'message': 'Update pci stat pools based on PCI device changes

At start up of nova-compute service, the PCI stat pools are

database. The pools are updated only when new device is added
or removed but not on any device changes like device type.

If an existing device is configured as SRIOV and nova-compute
is restarted, the pci_devices table gets updated but the device
is still listed under the old pool in pci_tracker.stats.pool
(in-memory object).

This patch looks for device type updates in existing devices
and updates the pools accordingly.

Change-Id: Id4ebb06e634a612c8be4be6c678d8265e0b99730

commit_message:
Update pci stat pools based on PCI device changes

At start up of nova-compute service, the PCI stat pools are
populated based on information in pci_devices table in Nova
database. The pools are updated only when new device is added
or removed but not on any device changes like device type.

If an existing device is configured as SRIOV and nova-compute
is restarted, the pci_devices table gets updated but the device
is still listed under the old pool in pci_tracker.stats.pool
(in-memory object).

This patch looks for device type updates in existing devices
and updates the pools accordingly.

Change-Id: Id4ebb06e634a612c8be4be6c678d8265e0b99730
Closes-Bug: #1892361

subject: [WIP] Allow disabling cluster update notifications
messages:
[{'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2020-11-03 01:21:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2020-11-05 10:22:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

why do we need this?'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2020-11-06 01:49:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@Bharat, thanks for your review. I should probably mark this one as WIP. Because there are still something not very clear for me.

Now Magnum running a periodic job per 10 seconds to sync cluster status from Heat and meanwhile sending notifications to MQ. However, there is no default consumer in telemetry projects to be able to claim those notifications. On our cloud, as a result, those notifications will be stacked there. Though based on the code, it shouldn't because only the job will only be triggered when it's in IN_PROGRESS status.

I will update more details later."}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2020-11-06 01:49:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated.'}]

commit_message:
Fix and avoid an erroneous heat API call

When the vnf maintenance plugin's implementation of
project_instance_pre() is called, vnf instance id is likely to be empty
because, for instance, the stack creation itself has not been done for
some reason.

This resolves a FT failue: vnfm.test_vnf_placement_policy.VnfTestCreate
.test_vnf_with_placement_policy_invalid. _get_instances_with_openstack()
is called on the cleanup path (delete_vnfd), though the vnf instance id
is not present because create_vnf must have failed due to the invalid
placement policy. And you must have seen the following error message in
the tacker-server log: "heatclient.exc.HTTPNotFound: ERROR:
The Stack (None) could not be found.", which masked the expected
tacker.extensions.vnfm.HeatClientException: "["invalid"] is not an
allowed value ["anti-affinity", "affinity", "soft-anti-affinity",
"soft-affinity"].

Related-Bug: #1886213
Change-Id: I8bd2f7e021476470df6131a7ac8abd402e6e1bd1

commit_message:
Refactor audit shard tests

The existing tests cover a lot of behaviors and carry around a lot of
state that makes them hard to extend in a descriptive mannor to cover
new or changed behaviors.

Change-Id: Ie52932d8d4a66b11c295d5568aa3a60895b84f3b

commit_message:
Fix for invalid LOG method syntax

Without this patch, tacker-conductor emits a logging error message like
"Error formatting log line msg='Update vnf lcm *s *s' ..."

Change-Id: Ifc93cac44df2be99202cc0348f555b796982e045

We found that some columns were not added to the DB due to a mismatch with the contents, so we added a new migration file. Also, since the type definition was different for the already registered columns, it was corrected.
=======================

Itsuro Oda
Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

Hi, would you update the patch set to include only bug fixes ?
-----------------------
Yes, this patch only contains bug fixes.
=======================

Koichiro Den

-----------------------

advance was created on the premise of varbinary and there was an
unmatch, therefore, at first, the DB type was matched. To modify
the code correctly, id decode was removed.

specification)

migration, but the procedure was incorrect, so it was restored.

specification)

with the contents, so I am adding a new migration file. Also, since
the type definition was different for the already registered columns,
it was also corrected.

commit_message:
Fix for package error during vnflcm creation

Execution "openstack vnflcm create" raises some package errors.
In order to avoid them, the exception process in vnflcm creation
is fixed.

Closes-bug: #1898963
Closes-bug: #1899112
Closes-bug: #1899134

Additional Information:
---------------------------------------
- vnf_lcm_subscription.id was decoded. The code we developed in
advance was created on the premise of varbinary and there was an
unmatch, therefore, at first, the DB type was matched. To modify
the code correctly, id decode was removed.
- Spec (Support LCM notifications for VNF based on ETSI NFV-SOL
specification)
There was a discrepancy with the content and I fixed the registered
migration, but the procedure was incorrect, so it was restored.
- Spec (Support LCM notifications for VNF based on ETSI NFV-SOL
specification)
I found that some columns were not added to the DB due to a mismatch
with the contents, so I am adding a new migration file. Also, since
the type definition was different for the already registered columns,
it was also corrected.

Change-Id: I0ee9d7e1e0c4ea26dd5894ad4fca302fe9bfd4d1

commit_message:
Add librsvg2-* to bindep.txt

Add the librsvg2-* package to bindep.txt. This package has been
required to build docs since the Related-Change. The package is added
to a new 'doc' profile in bindep.txt; if missing, the package will be
reported by:

  bindep doc

The 'doc' profile is added to the tox 'bindep' env command so that, if
missing, the package will always be reported by:

  tox -e bindep

Change-Id: I6c60c31ca8002133ab77f05f59359b25315b299c
Related-Change: I26cefda80d3234df68d7152b404e0a71da74ab90
Closes-Bug: 1903038

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-21 17:41:09.000000000', 'message': "Amend repo_all-back check to verify sync

Amended check to look for the presence of a file called
/var/www/repo/repo_sync_complete.

This addresses an issue where repo servers didn't automatically sync after
creating containers, other than the master repo server.
Ensures that HAProxy doesn't direct to unsynced repo servers.
And we will modify the repo server role to:
- restart lsyncd on the master upon creation of a server to trigger
  sync.
- to create a file when syncing is complete as a success flag on each
  repo server.

Change-Id: Ib7b64b09413fbdd8c630311d437539c9f876fac0
"}, {'created': '2019-05-21 20:40:23.000000000', 'message': 'Improve repo server haproxy healthcheck to verify repo synchronisation

This patch updates the healthcheck to test for the presence of the file
/var/www/repo/repo_sync_complete.

This addresses an issue where haproxy would direct traffic to redeployed
repo servers which were correctly serving the web root but had no
meaningful content.

The repo_sync_complete file is created by related changes to the
repo_server ansible role.
  
Partial-Bug: 1829930

commit_message:
Improve repo server haproxy healthcheck to verify repo synchronisation

This patch updates the healthcheck to test for the presence of the file
/var/www/repo/repo_sync_complete.
This addresses an issue where haproxy would direct traffic to redeployed
repo servers which were correctly serving the web root but had no
meaningful content.
The repo_sync_complete file is created by related changes to the
repo_server ansible role.

Partial-Bug: 1829930
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/660788/

Change-Id: Ib7b64b09413fbdd8c630311d437539c9f876fac0

[{'created': '2020-11-05 20:24:48.000000000', 'message': 'WIP fix redis on tls-e

NB: Giving this a test before unWIP

Now that paunch does a docker pull all the time in queens

commit_message:
[Queens-only] Fix redis pull error on tls-e

Now that paunch does a docker pull all the time in queens
(https://review.opendev.org/#/c/753082/), we need to
use the non-pcmk image. Otherwise we error out with:

  Error: image rh-osbs/rhosp13-openstack-redis:pcmklatest not found

Reported-By: Luca Miccini <lmiccini@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Damien Ciabrini <dciabrin@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I62d8790a8ec46128c0d74bad4debb0d03d05c835

commit_message:
Add a regression test for 5.12 compute API issue

In I147bf4d95e6d86ff1f967a8ce37260730f21d236 we wrote a breaking RPC change
for the 5.12 version as the accel_uuids parameter is not optional.

Adding a regression test to check the issue.

Change-Id: I1f3914e16294c99a625b3984ca0098d835cd9b92
Related-Bug: #1902925
(cherry picked from commit 8f79afd448f0234eab82eb1d3e3d48e0f657bcc7)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-03 15:24:56.000000000', 'message': 'Do not fail when depth is greater than rbd_max_clone_depth

Removed a sanity check in the code that raised an exception
if the clone depth of a volume to be cloned exceeded the
rbd_max_clone_depth config value.  A consequence of this
check was that if an operator lowered the value, volumes
whose clone depth was greater than the new value (as would
be allowed by the previous, higher setting) could no longer
be cloned.

Change-Id: I8c445058a25c2eca2fda91bdeb6befedae34ccf2
Closes-bug: #1901241
(cherry picked from commit 8d8d242c3924037e6774a681efabce4893a26646)
(cherry picked from commit 23a821b2a4bbb5696bc27044a455fc7837641111)
'}]
commit_message:
Do not fail when depth is greater than rbd_max_clone_depth

Removed a sanity check in the code that raised an exception
if the clone depth of a volume to be cloned exceeded the
rbd_max_clone_depth config value.  A consequence of this
check was that if an operator lowered the value, volumes
whose clone depth was greater than the new value (as would
be allowed by the previous, higher setting) could no longer
be cloned.

Change-Id: I8c445058a25c2eca2fda91bdeb6befedae34ccf2
Closes-bug: #1901241
(cherry picked from commit 8d8d242c3924037e6774a681efabce4893a26646)
(cherry picked from commit 23a821b2a4bbb5696bc27044a455fc7837641111)

commit_message:
Replace md5 with oslo version

md5 is not an approved algorithm in FIPS mode, and trying to
instantiate a hashlib.md5() will fail when the system is running in
FIPS mode.

md5 is allowed when in a non-security context.  There is a plan to
add a keyword parameter (usedforsecurity) to hashlib.md5() to annotate
whether or not the instance is being used in a security context.

In the case where it is not, the instantiation of md5 will be allowed.
See https://bugs.python.org/issue9216 for more details.

Some downstream python versions already support this parameter.  To
support these versions, a new encapsulation of md5() has been added to
oslo_utils.  See https://review.opendev.org/#/c/750031/

This patch is to replace the instances of hashlib.md5() with this new
encapsulation, adding an annotation indicating whether the usage is
a security context or not.

In this case, we use md5 in a single case, when creating an identifier
for a mount point.

Change-Id: I08226895818185337425ebffc2464db05f3969c9
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/760160

commit_message:
Add pypa/project-config

This is the repository for Zuul configuration for 3rd party CI
testing, which will live in a tenant added with the follow-on
Iaf8a4dac561440cc3337b00a738979db60b014ce.

Change-Id: I59650915fa6b6ae3bbe56a38ecf467baf97016b0

commit_message:
Add glance image import copy-image tests

Glance image can be copied to mutli stores using
copy-image import method. Adding test for the same.
- https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/image/v2/index.html#interoperable-image-import

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/760422/

Change-Id: Ia7c967946304a8c7a79774b4116dd6169822f3ac

commit_message:
Fix sorting API responses

neutron introduced a limitation on the sort_key parameter with [0],
making all sorting for lbaas API invalid. Add the necessary attributes
in order to allow all the sorting again that is happening in the
unit tests. It might be necessary or useful to add further keys later.

[0] https://review.opendev.org/705198

Change-Id: I9d7ec77921ad094ce68b114e2c16665e48818a72

[{'created': '2020-09-10 16:25:54.000000000', 'message': "Fix cache dir flooding when running from /tmp

Ansible invokes modules with executable placed under /tmp. This
causes stevedore caching to create bazillions of useless cache files.
When we can identify we run with executable under /tmp or if in the
target cache directory an empty file '.disable' is present - skip
writing cache.

Change-Id: Ic483ac68027505402ba32d7f612631e15a678d09
"}, {'created': '2020-09-14 14:06:26.000000000', 'message': "Fix cache dir flooding when running from /tmp

Ansible invokes modules with executable placed under /tmp. This
causes stevedore caching to create bazillions of useless cache files.
When we can identify we run with executable under /tmp or if in the

commit_message:
Fix cache dir flooding when running from /tmp

Ansible invokes modules with executable placed under /tmp. This
causes stevedore caching to create bazillions of useless cache files.
When we can identify we run with executable under /tmp or if in the
target cache directory an empty file '.disable' is present - skip
writing cache.

Change-Id: Ic483ac68027505402ba32d7f612631e15a678d09

commit_message:
Fix the compute RPC 5.12 issue

In I147bf4d95e6d86ff1f967a8ce37260730f21d236 we added a new argument for
the rebuild_instance() RPC method. Unfortunately, we missed to that it
needs to be optional for older versions.

Adding a default none value for it so rolling upgrades would work.

Change-Id: I59c5e56b00114fea5ec19fa63ec73f032dc3bd5c
Closes-Bug: #1902925

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-10 15:37:15.000000000', 'message': "tox: Enable parallel docs builds

While we're here, specifying the doctree directory and configuring use
of saved environments doesn't really make sense when we blast all
previous doc build artefacts away on each build, so stop specifying
those.

Change-Id: I2b04a5c0ac121954aed91ae133e249a2e5813ee0
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
tox: Enable parallel docs builds

While we're here, specifying the doctree directory and configuring use
of saved environments doesn't really make sense when we blast all
previous doc build artefacts away on each build, so stop specifying
those.

Change-Id: I2b04a5c0ac121954aed91ae133e249a2e5813ee0
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
s3api: Avoid staticweb redirects in container listings

This could happen if s3_acl was enabled, which would prevent REMOTE_USER
from being set.

Change-Id: I2561d5310c4f4df502d020e41b91058d88f13b15
Closes-Bug: 1833287

commit_message:
Fix replica number input type

We don't need to specify input type manually. Django will render
input[type=number] for forms.IntegerField

Change-Id: I4c8d0ae5d82088745bdaa00f15b1c62866cb4070

commit_message:
Ensure the right key is selected

Ensure the right key is selected on pre-systemd deploys. Whether
to request unit specific keys is already gated on the
request_per_unit_key *1 this patch applies the same logic to
_key_name for selecting the key.

*1 https://github.com/openstack/charm-ceph-radosgw/blob/master/hooks/hooks.py#L258

Also update testing to use cephx auth.

Change-Id: I92fe75fb7f483cc70b35e48587cf376a16d856a5
Closes-Bug: #1899676

commit_message:
Keepalived version check

[0] introduced keepalived_use_no_track config option which defaults to
True.
Here I add and extra runtime check to check keepalived version, and
only if that version is bigger than 2.0.0 add the no_track option to
the keepalived config file.

[0] https://review.opendev.org/745641

Change-Id: I16dce5b3faf62ce02535170a1b0e1ad22ee8ac30
Closes-Bug: #1896506

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-27 06:33:55.000000000', 'message': '[IBM DS8K]: Fixed rest API issue to get bundle

Cinder driver for IBM storage DS8K is calling the unsupported
rest API "api/v1", which is failing with R9 version. Some
how this unsupported API is working with R7 and R8 versions.

Modified IBM DS8K driver to use the supported API to get the
bundle information.

closes bug: #1895510

Change-Id: If8c17eb48b67e7b109e19e4b064260cb52b5cecf
(cherry picked from commit b477632a664f37be9da4ef7c2276fdf191710d75)
'}]
commit_message:
[IBM DS8K]: Fixed rest API issue to get bundle

Cinder driver for IBM storage DS8K is calling the unsupported
rest API "api/v1", which is failing with R9 version. Some
how this unsupported API is working with R7 and R8 versions.

Modified IBM DS8K driver to use the supported API to get the
bundle information.

closes bug: #1895510

Change-Id: If8c17eb48b67e7b109e19e4b064260cb52b5cecf
(cherry picked from commit b477632a664f37be9da4ef7c2276fdf191710d75)

[{'created': '2020-11-04 07:03:57.000000000', 'message': 'CI: Temporarily disable rabbitmq internal tls

Due to an incompatibility between oslo.messaging and new kombu/amqp mix -
Nova RMQ TLS is not working. See [1] and [2].

[1]: https://launchpad.net/bugs/1902696
[2]: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/761194/

Change-Id: Ibffd96fe008b6fcefcd73ac3c1bc579507dca5c7
'}]
commit_message:
CI: Temporarily disable rabbitmq internal tls

Due to an incompatibility between oslo.messaging and new kombu/amqp mix -
Nova RMQ TLS is not working. See [1] and [2].

[1]: https://launchpad.net/bugs/1902696
[2]: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/761194/

Change-Id: Ibffd96fe008b6fcefcd73ac3c1bc579507dca5c7

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-30 16:28:20.000000000', 'message': 'Use barbican.conf in barbican-manage

This patch updates the hsm subcommand in barbican-manage to read
any required values from barbican.conf.  Users may continue to
specify those values as parameters in the command line, and those
values will take precedence over values in barbican.conf.

Existing scripts that call barbican-manage should continue to work
as expected as the values passed will be used instead of looking
into barbican.conf.

Change-Id: I4e86e73bbdef0e16d3699cec1cc8f7e17dfb643b
(cherry picked from commit 666034475a3fed207c52c70f4041d749d7630ef7)
'}]
commit_message:
Use barbican.conf in barbican-manage

This patch updates the hsm subcommand in barbican-manage to read
any required values from barbican.conf.  Users may continue to
specify those values as parameters in the command line, and those
values will take precedence over values in barbican.conf.

Existing scripts that call barbican-manage should continue to work
as expected as the values passed will be used instead of looking
into barbican.conf.

Change-Id: I4e86e73bbdef0e16d3699cec1cc8f7e17dfb643b
(cherry picked from commit 666034475a3fed207c52c70f4041d749d7630ef7)

hacking 3.0.1 fix the pinning of flake8 to avoid bringing in a new

Change-Id: I4aca49327fb8fb0f03b7c262f8247186245cbc19

commit_message:
Bump hacking min version to 3.0.1

hacking 3.0.1 fix the pinning of flake8 to avoid bringing in a new
version with new checks.

bumping the min version for hacking so that any older hacking versions
which auto adopt the new checks are not used.

Change-Id: I4aca49327fb8fb0f03b7c262f8247186245cbc19

commit_message:
Rename jobs from the experimental queue

Jobs "networking-bgpvpn-bagpipe-dsvm-install" and
"networking-bgpvpn-dsvm-install" was renamed recently as part of zuulv3
migration to networking-bgpvpn-bagpipe-install and to
networking-bgpvpn-install

commit_message:
Fix l-c testing for ubuntu focal

As per victoria cycle testing runtime and community goal[1]
we need to migrate upstream CI/CD to Ubuntu Focal(20.04).

- Bump the lower constraints for required deps which added python3.8 support
in their later version.

Story: #2007865
Task: #40206

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/victoria/migrate-ci-cd-jobs-to-ubuntu-focal.html

Change-Id: I3205d196ebaa1c7eaf5345b3c42aa818cdee0f21
(cherry picked from commit 8ff3f80102ae184227d4f8cb5f82bedee987b804)

subject: Introduce FT keystone client initialization retry
messages:
[{'account_id': 32395, 'date': '2020-10-29 03:52:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 26222, 'date': '2020-10-31 15:38:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 17255, 'date': '2020-11-04 06:43:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 32395, 'date': '2020-11-05 06:25:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I should've updated the commit message before it's merged to mention a probably relevant bug report but it's too late. My apologies for the delay.

At least I found out a case where a central mysqld server suddenly restarts without any error message and FT keystone client initialization fails during the period. The following serverfault.com question looks like a similar issue: https://serverfault.com/questions/1030351/mysql-randomly-restarts-with-different-args."}, {'account_id': 17255, 'date': '2020-11-05 17:40:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your comment.
I merged this patch because it seems to solve many other FT errors. Sorry that I didn't wait for your update.

Related-bug tag is included in the commit message. How about writing a comment on the Launchpad bugs if you have useful information?"}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-29 03:52:08.000000000', 'message': "Introduce FT keystone client initialization retry

I noticed that keystone client initialization is likely to fail due to a
temporary InternalServerError, leading to nondeterministic FT failures.
Let's make it tolerable against them.

Change-Id: I788645d7d489504b4a1c77da010fe0221bf746b7
Related-Bug: #1886213
"}]
commit_message:
Introduce FT keystone client initialization retry

I noticed that keystone client initialization is likely to fail due to a
temporary InternalServerError, leading to nondeterministic FT failures.
Let's make it tolerable against them.

Change-Id: I788645d7d489504b4a1c77da010fe0221bf746b7
Related-Bug: #1886213

subject: zuul: Stop testing against Tempest
messages: [{'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-11-05 12:49:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 27900, 'date': '2020-11-05 16:09:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-05 12:49:56.000000000', 'message': "zuul: Stop testing against Tempest

Neither Tempest itself nor any of the service projects use OSC. As such,
there's no reason to run Tempest jobs here. It's simply a waste of
resources.

Conflicts:
	.zuul.yaml

NOTE(stephenfin): Conflicts are because we have both Python 2 and Python
3 Tempest jobs here, whereas it's Python 3 only from Victoria on.

Change-Id: I18c45d28798c20c231b945f6fad077012cdbbaee
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 58b6920d3bfe5ccdd17bccf1f8e4ef578a6a94be)
(cherry picked from commit 1080c261462be7915b82ea28d668684917d1fd67)
"}]
commit_message:
zuul: Stop testing against Tempest

Neither Tempest itself nor any of the service projects use OSC. As such,
there's no reason to run Tempest jobs here. It's simply a waste of
resources.

Conflicts:
	.zuul.yaml

NOTE(stephenfin): Conflicts are because we have both Python 2 and Python
3 Tempest jobs here, whereas it's Python 3 only from Victoria on.

Change-Id: I18c45d28798c20c231b945f6fad077012cdbbaee
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 58b6920d3bfe5ccdd17bccf1f8e4ef578a6a94be)
(cherry picked from commit 1080c261462be7915b82ea28d668684917d1fd67)

commit_message:
Add a regression test for 5.12 compute API issue

In I147bf4d95e6d86ff1f967a8ce37260730f21d236 we wrote a breaking RPC change
for the 5.12 version as the accel_uuids parameter is not optional.

Adding a regression test to check the issue.

Change-Id: I1f3914e16294c99a625b3984ca0098d835cd9b92
Related-Bug: #1902925

We are tracking the TripleO bug in Bugzilla https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1877510'}, {'account_id': 7973, 'date': '2020-11-05 15:25:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

[{'created': '2020-10-28 14:50:04.000000000', 'message': "Use serial number or label for PKCS#11 tokens

The PKCS#11 standard does not make any guarantees about
slot numbering, so the slot ID alone should not be used
to identify a token.  Instead, the token's Serial Number
or Label should be used to ensure the correct token
is being used.

This patch adds two new config options to the p11_crypto
plugin: token_serial_number and token_label.

These new options allow for more flexibility in configuring
the PKCS#11 module.  The config may include either the token's
serial number or its label.

Serial numbers should be unique, so they take higher precedence.

Some devices allow tokens to have the same label, so this patch
ensures that only one token with the specified label is present.

If both serial number and label are given, only the serial number
will be checked and an error will be raised if it is not found.

slot_id continues to work as expected, although its use is discouraged
and may be deprecated in a future patch.  If the conf contains
only the slot_id, it will be used.  If the serial number or
label are also provided, the new logic will ignore the slot_id
and search for the serial number or label instead.

Change-Id: I115cf1a7006a6c85f37c5e50ded13134a3dfd1a3
(cherry picked from commit 69459a0ecf278410835e469347c5f32f5b43ffd5)

and may be deprecated in a future patch.  If the conf contains
only the slot_id, it will be used.  If the serial number or
label are also provided, the new logic will ignore the slot_id
and search for the serial number or label instead.

Change-Id: I115cf1a7006a6c85f37c5e50ded13134a3dfd1a3
(cherry picked from commit 69459a0ecf278410835e469347c5f32f5b43ffd5)
"}]
commit_message:
Use serial number or label for PKCS#11 tokens

The PKCS#11 standard does not make any guarantees about
slot numbering, so the slot ID alone should not be used
to identify a token.  Instead, the token's Serial Number
or Label should be used to ensure the correct token
is being used.

This patch adds two new config options to the p11_crypto
plugin: token_serial_number and token_label.

These new options allow for more flexibility in configuring
the PKCS#11 module.  The config may include either the token's
serial number or its label.

Serial numbers should be unique, so they take higher precedence.

Some devices allow tokens to have the same label, so this patch
ensures that only one token with the specified label is present.

If both serial number and label are given, only the serial number
will be checked and an error will be raised if it is not found.

slot_id continues to work as expected, although its use is discouraged
and may be deprecated in a future patch.  If the conf contains
only the slot_id, it will be used.  If the serial number or
label are also provided, the new logic will ignore the slot_id
and search for the serial number or label instead.

Change-Id: I115cf1a7006a6c85f37c5e50ded13134a3dfd1a3
(cherry picked from commit 69459a0ecf278410835e469347c5f32f5b43ffd5)

[{'created': '2020-10-19 21:18:10.000000000', 'message': 'Add manila client,ui,tempest plugin core teams

The manila contributor team has grown through mentoring
new core reviewers. We typically spend one or more
development cycles with a prospective core by asking them
to pick up a cross-project liaison role, sharing domain
knowledge in 1-1 sessions, assigning code reviews and
assessing them and reviewing code together.

By splitting core teams we can allow contributors to gain the
ropes to maintain all of manila eventually by beginning
in these distinct delivery items: SDK/CLI, UI and
Tempest tests.

Change-Id: I4e46b6d982a202f5d8f3f9cf7183e931fe5678bd

commit_message:
Add manila client,ui,tempest plugin core teams

The manila contributor team has grown through mentoring
new core reviewers. We typically spend one or more
development cycles with a prospective core by asking them
to pick up a cross-project liaison role, sharing domain
knowledge in 1-1 sessions, assigning code reviews and
assessing them and reviewing code together.

By splitting core teams we can allow contributors to gain the
ropes to maintain all of manila eventually by beginning
in these distinct delivery items: SDK/CLI, UI and
Tempest tests.

Change-Id: I4e46b6d982a202f5d8f3f9cf7183e931fe5678bd

subject: Fix OVN functional test
messages:
[{'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2020-10-28 17:11:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 16011, 'date': '2020-10-29 16:18:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Turns out, the OVN driver does not support the net_mtu_writeable extension. To make this work, one must define path_mtu = 1558 in ml2_ini.conf and global_physnet_mtu >= 1558 in neutron.conf. When a tenant network is created, mtu will default to 1500 (1558-58 bytes). When a provider network is created, it will default to global_physnet_mtu value. This can be overridden with physical_network_mtus.

The MTU of the provider interface (and VTEP interface) in the OS should equal global_physnet_mtu value.'}, {'account_id': 16011, 'date': '2020-10-29 16:24:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2020-10-29 19:36:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'm wondering if instead of the override for the test we want to make this change in the template?"}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2020-10-30 12:57:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'm also wondering how https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/82dcda47d52549bdbf1ee4906f85ef60 is passing..."}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2020-10-30 12:58:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2020-11-02 07:29:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Published edit on patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2020-11-03 22:40:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 13095, 'date': '2020-11-05 14:28:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Fix the buildimages jobs: ensure-tox role

- call ensure-tox and use its output.
  tox is not available by default on the images anymore.
- try to workaround the issue with newer pip and old
  system setuptools, see:
  * https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/issues/1694#issuecomment-466010982
- refact the base buildimages job a bit and call the bindep
  role from the pre phase, where it belongs more "naturally".

Change-Id: I2f8736c63b2e1c4360b7175cf12cf71a2ea4e4ff

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-24 08:27:38.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Process ingress multicast traffic for 224.0.0.X separately"

This reverts commit b8be1a05facff2ba8b484902494ce1663e0aae7c.

As was reported in bug [1] this patch broke multicast traffic send
from ports with disabled port security. And that broke L3HA routers
as keepalived processes couldn't talk to each other.
During attempt to fix that issue with keepalived we found out another
corner cases which we may break and in fact to fix them, we would
effectively revert this change and allow multicast traffic for all
ports in e.g. networks with ports which have port security and ports
which don't have port security and are on same node.
As we also don't really know what other corner cases we may hit going
further with that, lets revert this patch.
As a follow up patch I will propose new patch which will document
differences in handling multicast traffic between iptables and
openvswitch based firewall drivers.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1899967

Change-Id: I37a8b33cf8e16d5bb5dc1966fc2dca6bb619026c
Closes-Bug: #1899967
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Process ingress multicast traffic for 224.0.0.X separately"

This reverts commit b8be1a05facff2ba8b484902494ce1663e0aae7c.

As was reported in bug [1] this patch broke multicast traffic send
from ports with disabled port security. And that broke L3HA routers
as keepalived processes couldn't talk to each other.
During attempt to fix that issue with keepalived we found out another
corner cases which we may break and in fact to fix them, we would
effectively revert this change and allow multicast traffic for all
ports in e.g. networks with ports which have port security and ports
which don't have port security and are on same node.
As we also don't really know what other corner cases we may hit going
further with that, lets revert this patch.
As a follow up patch I will propose new patch which will document
differences in handling multicast traffic between iptables and
openvswitch based firewall drivers.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1899967

Change-Id: I37a8b33cf8e16d5bb5dc1966fc2dca6bb619026c
Closes-Bug: #1899967

commit_message:
Unskip Device detach compute tests on Focal

During migrating the testing to Ubutnu Focal,
we skipped few device detach tests due to bug#1882521
- https://review.opendev.org/#/c/734700/8

Now Nova bug#1882521 is fixed so let's unskip those tests.

Change-Id: I9e48d72fc1192a775671ca339e0339e8ec1afa17
Related-Bug: #1882521
Related-Bug: #1894804

commit_message:
Use the default flavor name when flavor parameter is not defined

This patch ensures that the default flavor is used when the flavor
parameter (Overcloud{{role.name}}Flavor) is not explicitly defined
in deployment templates and plan, to emulate the behavior in tht
to pick up the defalt flavor to deploy baremetal instances.

Closes-Bug: #1901472
Change-Id: I6970a7fc294305d4fe6ad43b9c2e29090a1ecb37

[{'created': '2020-11-02 12:22:35.000000000', 'message': 'Do not require authentication for the validator CLI

Since most of the actions of the validator is based on the filesystem,
we really don't need to require auth.
The only subcommand that might require it is the "run", since it might
go through the inventory generation.

Also, pass the "--os-cloud" parameter down to the
tripleo-ansible-inventory script. Value is hardcoded, since it is an
entry name we can't set (yet). It allows to authenticate only for the
relevant part of the validation run.

Resolves: rhbz#1892323
Closes-Bug: #1902052

Change-Id: I32c1e006d10ceb541aadb486befd8aa8fc6aa045
(cherry picked from commit aafd981948b28b7786c9c8d5f9b0e7e1b3f9371f)
'}]
commit_message:
Do not require authentication for the validator CLI

Since most of the actions of the validator is based on the filesystem,
we really don't need to require auth.
The only subcommand that might require it is the "run", since it might
go through the inventory generation.

Also, pass the "--os-cloud" parameter down to the
tripleo-ansible-inventory script. Value is hardcoded, since it is an
entry name we can't set (yet). It allows to authenticate only for the
relevant part of the validation run.

Resolves: rhbz#1892323
Closes-Bug: #1902052

Change-Id: I32c1e006d10ceb541aadb486befd8aa8fc6aa045
(cherry picked from commit aafd981948b28b7786c9c8d5f9b0e7e1b3f9371f)

subject: tox: Set minimum Python version for lower-constraints
messages: [{'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-11-05 12:47:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-11-05 14:18:34.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned\n\nWe're going to go with bumping the lower constraints instead https://review.opendev.org/#/c/761617/"}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-05 12:47:14.000000000', 'message': "tox: Set minimum Python version for lower-constraints

We failed to merge change I3205d196ebaa1c7eaf5345b3c42aa818cdee0f21
before the stable/victoria branch was cut, meaning our lower-constraints
job cannot run against the default Python version on Focal in Victoria.
Rather than backporting the minimum version bump patch, which isn't
allowed per stable policy, simply set the 'basepython' for this job.

This is stable-only since we typically should use the newest Python
version to make sure out minimum versions of various requirements are
compatible.

Change-Id: If4d7ec538ab47b8f4879064c12e554ed989d4fd8
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Stable-Only
"}]
commit_message:
tox: Set minimum Python version for lower-constraints

We failed to merge change I3205d196ebaa1c7eaf5345b3c42aa818cdee0f21
before the stable/victoria branch was cut, meaning our lower-constraints
job cannot run against the default Python version on Focal in Victoria.
Rather than backporting the minimum version bump patch, which isn't
allowed per stable policy, simply set the 'basepython' for this job.

This is stable-only since we typically should use the newest Python
version to make sure out minimum versions of various requirements are
compatible.

Change-Id: If4d7ec538ab47b8f4879064c12e554ed989d4fd8
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Stable-Only

commit_message:
Reduce number of processes on small systems

Even the most modest 4C/8T system would run with the maximum 16 processes
due to the calculation being VCPU*2.

We devide amount of CPUs to number of threads for hyperthreaded CPUs

Change-Id: I40c292b7ba2f48a02ffe4c45d984ea7af6460f62

[{'created': '2020-07-31 13:52:31.000000000', 'message': '[fix] Append v3/v1 to auth_url/magnum_url if discovery fails

Sometimes, version discovery fails when Magnum cannot talk to
Keystone via specified trustee_keystone_interface intended for
cluster instances either because it is not unreachable from the
controller or CA certs are missing for TLS enabled interface and the
returned auth_url or magnum_url may not be suffixed with /v3 or /v1
respectively, in which case append the url with the suffix so that
instances can still talk to Keystone/Magnum.

Story: 2007868
Task: 40235

Change-Id: Iae831dc549a855269b4639c31676e75d2a9433d6
(cherry picked from commit 5a688b186902b1a0b7b1ee01519cba275f07dfab)

commit_message:
[fix] Append v3/v1 to auth_url/magnum_url if discovery fails

Sometimes, version discovery fails when Magnum cannot talk to
Keystone via specified trustee_keystone_interface intended for
cluster instances either because it is not unreachable from the
controller or CA certs are missing for TLS enabled interface and the
returned auth_url or magnum_url may not be suffixed with /v3 or /v1
respectively, in which case append the url with the suffix so that
instances can still talk to Keystone/Magnum.

Story: 2007868
Task: 40235

Change-Id: Iae831dc549a855269b4639c31676e75d2a9433d6
(cherry picked from commit 5a688b186902b1a0b7b1ee01519cba275f07dfab)

commit_message:
Update master for stable/victoria

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/victoria.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/victoria.

Change-Id: Iad61fa88f8afa7d5f39154b9466338b417bbf40a
Sem-Ver: feature

[{'created': '2020-11-05 10:12:02.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/victoria

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/victoria branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I609fd52a6ffdf24ab2d92136b0f627e42158ff92
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/victoria

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/victoria branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I609fd52a6ffdf24ab2d92136b0f627e42158ff92

commit_message:
Add CI molecule job for ansible modules future

Add tripleo-ansible-centos-8-molecule-tripleo-modules-future that
tests modules/action plugins against ansible 2.10.

Also fix the modules current/future trigger conditions to cover
changes in ansible*-requirements as well.

Change-Id: I0c24a799f9eb01af9a8e84239c52e1d425165250
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6926, 'name': 'Bogdan Dobrelya', 'email': 'bdobreli@redhat.com', 'username': 'bogdando'}, {'_account_id': 7353, 'name': 'Kevin Carter', 'email': 'kevin@cloudnull.com', 'username': 'cloudnull'}, {'_account_id': 10969, 'name': 'Shnaidman Sagi (Sergey)', 'display_name': 'Shnaidman Sagi', 'email': 'sshnaidm@redhat.com', 'username': 'sergsh'}, {'_account_id': 11491, 'name': 'Gael Chamoulaud', 'email': 'gchamoul@redhat.com', 'username': 'gchamoul'}, {'_account_id': 13861, 'name': 'yatin', 'email': 'ykarel@redhat.com', 'username': 'yatinkarel'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 24162, 'name': 'Sorin Sbârnea', 'display_name': 'zbr', 'email': 'ssbarnea@redhat.com', 'username': 'ssbarnea', 'status': 'do not feed the troll 🥕'}, {'_account_id': 28223, 'name': 'Cedric Jeanneret', 'display_name': 'cjeanner (Tengu)', 'email': 'cjeanner@redhat.com', 'username': 'cjeanner'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2020-11-03 11:10:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2020-11-03 11:11:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

the next step would be create an extra molecule job or jobs for ansible 2.10'}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2020-11-03 12:49:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 11491, 'date': '2020-11-03 13:32:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2020-11-03 20:46:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I think we split support, I think we should support ansible 2.10+ whole sale.'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2020-11-04 09:12:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

That patch combines unrelated stuff. For example linting should happen with a single version of Ansible, preferably the laters.

The reason for using latest Ansible on linting is that newer versions always have extra features/deprecations that can help identify changes needed during linting.

For functional/integration testing, the answer is bit different, you may want a lower bounds and an upper bounds, first one being more important than second.

Still, do not combine changes related to linting with ones related to testing.

Also, I would recommend avoiding hardcoding ansible version in environment names or jobs, as it would require a lot of extra maintainance every 6 months.

If we need to support ranges, better to have a "-lower" constraints and an -"upper" ones, just like openstack did for years.'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2020-11-04 09:13:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Also, do not confuse requirements with constraints, they may use very similar files, but their purpose is quite different.'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2020-11-05 10:42:24.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-03 11:10:14.000000000', 'message': 'Support tox for ansible v2.10

Parametrize tox to run the given ANSIBLE_VERSION, e.g. 2.10.
Defaults to an empty value.

Allow tox -emodules to be executed as well with properly installed
deps. Aslo make pre-commit to just depend on ansible without a
given version (rely on the version provided via tox preparaions).

Example use:

$ tox -evenv -emodules
venv recreate: .tox/venv
venv installdeps: -rtest-requirements.txt, -ransible-requirements.txt
venv installed: ansible==2.9.15...
modules recreate: .tox/modules
modules installdeps: ..., -ransible-requirements.txt, -rmolecule-requirements.txt
modules installed: ...,ansible==2.9.15,...

$ ANSIBLE_VERSION=2.10 tox -evenv -emodules
venv recreate: .tox/venv
venv installdeps: -rtest-requirements.txt, -ransible2.10-requirements.txt
venv installed: ansible==2.10.1,ansible-base==2.10.3...
modules recreate: .tox/modules
modules installdeps: ..., -ransible2.10-requirements.txt, -rmolecule2.10-requirements.txt
modules installed: ...,ansible==2.10.1,ansible-base==2.10.3...

Change-Id: Id9a96cf9b01b57fc60f493c887c73f1d289c3faa
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Support tox for ansible v2.10

Parametrize tox to run the given ANSIBLE_VERSION, e.g. 2.10.
Defaults to an empty value.

Allow tox -emodules to be executed as well with properly installed
deps. Aslo make pre-commit to just depend on ansible without a
given version (rely on the version provided via tox preparaions).

Example use:

$ tox -evenv -emodules
venv recreate: .tox/venv
venv installdeps: -rtest-requirements.txt, -ransible-requirements.txt
venv installed: ansible==2.9.15...
modules recreate: .tox/modules
modules installdeps: ..., -ransible-requirements.txt, -rmolecule-requirements.txt
modules installed: ...,ansible==2.9.15,...

$ ANSIBLE_VERSION=2.10 tox -evenv -emodules
venv recreate: .tox/venv
venv installdeps: -rtest-requirements.txt, -ransible2.10-requirements.txt
venv installed: ansible==2.10.1,ansible-base==2.10.3...
modules recreate: .tox/modules
modules installdeps: ..., -ransible2.10-requirements.txt, -rmolecule2.10-requirements.txt
modules installed: ...,ansible==2.10.1,ansible-base==2.10.3...

Change-Id: Id9a96cf9b01b57fc60f493c887c73f1d289c3faa
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
